items.title: Job Opportunities as of November 4, 2020
items.summary: View a list of our current and upcoming job opportunities, including: Election Specialist I  Environmental Health Specialist Trainee, I, & II   Payroll Clerk

items.title: Housing and Renter Support during COVID-19
items.summary: There are local resources for both renters and homeowners available in Sonoma County. To learn more about these resources visit Housing & Renter Support

items.title: Shaded fuel break to be constructed in Sonoma Valley Regional Park
items.summary: On Wednesday, Nov. 11, Sonoma County Regional Parks will begin construction of a shaded fuel break in Sonoma Valley Regional Park in an effort to improve forest health, promote park resiliency, and modulate the severity of future wildfires.

items.title: Guidance for Outdoor Visitation and  Activities Relative to the 2019-Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) in Long-Term Care  Facilities
items.summary: Much  of the past guidance from state and federal health officials has  focused on  protecting nursing home and long-term care residents from  COVID-19 by limiting  non-essential visitation.

items.title: Childhood Lead Poisoning Prevention Week
items.summary: October 25th through 31st is Childhood Lead Poisoning Prevention Week. This year’s statewide Lead Week message is “Even small amounts of lead can harm a child’s health.

items.title: Sonoma County adopts enhanced program to reduce COVID-19 transmission by supporting those most impacted
items.summary: The Sonoma County Board of Supervisors today unanimously endorsed a suite of actions to support those most negatively impacted by the spread of coronavirus including those in low-income, essential worker and Latinx communities

items.title: El Condado de Sonoma adopta un programa intensivo para reducir el contagio de COVID-19 respaldando a aquéllos más afectados
items.summary: La Junta de Supervisores del Condado de Sonoma aprobó hoy un   conjunto  de acciones para apoyar a los más afectados por el contagio del  coronavirus, como aquéllos   en comunidades de bajos ingresos, de  trabajadores esenciales y latinxs.

items.title: More Personal Care Services Now Allowed to Operate Indoors with Modifications
items.summary: The California Department of Public Health  updated their guidelines  today, allowing more personal care services  to resume indoor operations  with modifications

items.title: El Condado expande las oportunidades de hacerse las pruebas para residentes afectados desproporcionadamente por COVID-19
items.summary: El Condado de Sonoma está duplicando la cantidad de puestos móviles de prueba para el público a partir del martes 20 de octubre, y recomienda a los residentes, en particular a residents en areas donde el coronavirus a afectado desproporcionadamente que se hagan la prueba, tengan ono síntomas o hayan estado expuestos o no a alguien que sea COVID-19 positivo.

items.title: County expands testing opportunities for residents disproportionately impacted by COVID-19
items.summary: The County of Sonoma is doubling the number of pop-up test sites available to the public beginning Tuesday, Oct. 20 and is encouraging residents, particularly those disproportionately impacted by the coronavirus, to be tested regardless of whether they have symptoms or have been exposed to someone who is COVID-19 positive.

items.title: Sonoma County continues increased COVID-19 testing with new community testing site in Windsor
items.summary: A new COVID-19 testing site will open in Windsor on Monday October 19, 2020, moving from Petaluma after nearly six months serving the south county areas.

items.title: El condado de Sonoma continúa la ampliación de pruebas de COVID-19 con un nuevo centro comunitario de pruebas en Windsor
items.summary: El lunes 19 de octubre se inaugurará un nuevo centro de pruebas de COVID-  19 en Windsor.

items.title: COVID-19 Rental Assistance For Sonoma County Renters and Landlords
items.summary: Renter households having trouble paying rent or utilities due to COVID-19 job loss or reduced hours; have a COVID-19 positive exposure or diagnosis.* Landlords who have tenants behind on rent due to COVID-19 job loss or reduced hours; or have a COVID-19 positive exposure or diagnosis.

items.title: COVID-19 Asistencia de Renta para Inquilinos Propietarios en el Condado de Sonoma
items.summary: Hogar de inquilinos con dificultades   pagando renta  o servicios públicos de hogar a causa de pérdida de trabajo o horas  reducidas en relación a COVID-19; si a tenido exposición positiva de  COVID-19 o diagnóstico.*Propietarios de hogar que tienen inquilinos con  renta atrasada a causa de pérdida de trabajo o  horas reducidas en   relación a COVID-19; si a tenido exposición positiva de COVID-19 o  diagnóstico.

items.title: Guidance for a Safer Halloween and Dia de los Muertos During the COVID-19 Pandemic
items.summary: The COVID-19 virus continues to circulate in communities in Sonoma County causing severe illness, hospitalizations and deaths among our residents. Individuals can spread COVID-19 even without symptoms.
